Name:
Asia Online
Language Studio
Notes: Language Studio is a server platform for mass scale translation designed as well as a set of desktop tools to aid in translation. Language Studio is a hybrid rules-based and statistical machine translation (SMT) platform.

Name: Apertium
Platform:
Unix compatible
Precompiled packages available for Debian
Notes: Rule-based, shallow transfer; all programs and language data are free and open source

Name: Anusaaraka
Notes: Rule-based, deep parser based, paninian framework based; all programs and language data are free and open-source

Name: IBM
Notes: Both rule-based and statistical models developed by IBM Research. Only the rule-based engine is available as a product, WebSphere Translation Server.

Name: Moses (machine translation)
Notes: Drop-in replacement for Pharaoh, features factored translation models and decoding of confusion networks.

Name: Moses for Mere Mortals
Notes: Free open source; based on Moses; translation memories integration.

Name: NiuTrans
Notes: Competitive performance for Chinese translation tasks; statistical machine translation.  Supports phrase-based, hierarchical phrase-based, and syntax-based (string-to-tree, tree-to-string, and tree-to-tree) models for research purposes.

Name: Bing Translator
Notes: Microsoft's linguistically informed statistical MT system

Name: SAIC Omnifluent
Notes: Hybrid machine translation combines rule-based machine translation and statistical machine translation, integrated with automatic speech recognition on a single platform that translates text and audio files.

Name: Babylon
Price: Depend on license ($9.90–$89 for one license)
Notes: Prompts to install the Babylon Toolbar, a browser hijacker which is difficult to remove.
